after: The 172P, or Skyhawk P, was introduced in 1981 to solve the reliability problems of the "N" engine. The Lycoming O-320-D2J was a great improvement.

The "P" model also saw the maximum flap deflection decreased from 40 degrees to 30 to allow a gross weight increase from 2,300Â lb (1,043Â kg) to 2,400Â lb (1,089Â kg). A wet wing was optional, with a capacity of 62 US gallons of fuel.[14]
